title: Directs the division of criminal justice services to establish and operate a uniform statewide higher education emergency notification system
summary: Directs the division of criminal justice service to establish and operate a uniform statewide higher education emergency notification system.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3084

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to directing the division
         of criminal justice services to develop and provide for the  operation
         of a uniform statewide higher education emergency notification system

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new section  837-s
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  837-S.  UNIFORM  STATEWIDE  HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION
    4  SYSTEM. 1. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION:
    5    (A) "HIGHER EDUCATION" SHALL HAVE THE SAME MEANING AS  IS ASCRIBED  TO
    6  SUCH TERM BY SUBDIVISION EIGHT OF SECTION TWO OF THE EDUCATION LAW.
    7    (B) "WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE" SHALL HAVE THE SAME MEANING AS IS
    8  ASCRIBED  TO  SUCH TERM BY SUBDIVISION NINE OF SECTION THREE HUNDRED ONE
    9  OF THE COUNTY LAW.
   10    (C) "WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS SERVICE SUPPLIER"  SHALL  HAVE  THE  SAME
   11  MEANING  AS  IS  ASCRIBED  TO SUCH TERM BY SUBDIVISION TWELVE OF SECTION
   12  THREE HUNDRED ONE OF THE COUNTY LAW.
   13    2. THE DIVISION, IN CONSULTATION WITH  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  EDUCATION,
   14  PUBLIC  SERVICE  COMMISSION AND THE OFFICE FOR TECHNOLOGY, SHALL DEVELOP
   15  AND PROVIDE FOR THE OPERATION OF A UNIFORM  STATEWIDE  HIGHER  EDUCATION
   16  EMERGENCY  NOTIFICATION  SYSTEM.  EACH  INSTITUTION  OF HIGHER EDUCATION
   17  SHALL HAVE THE SOLE DISCRETION AND RESPONSIBILITY OF DETERMINING WHEN AN
   18  ALERT WILL BE ISSUED.  THE PURPOSE OF SUCH SYSTEM SHALL BE TO:
   19    (A) PROVIDE FOR A UNIFORM ELECTRONIC DATABASE,  TO  BE  MAINTAINED  BY
   20  EACH  INSTITUTION  OF  HIGHER  EDUCATION,  OF THE ELECTRONIC ADDRESS AND
   21  WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE NUMBER OF EACH FACULTY MEMBER AND STUDENT
   22  OF SUCH INSTITUTION;
   23    (B) REQUIRE THE SERVICE PROVIDER, WHICH HAS ENTERED  INTO  A  CONTRACT
   24  WITH  THE DIVISION, TO PROVIDE A FACILITY THROUGH WHICH EACH INSTITUTION

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05479-01-1

       A. 3084                             2

    1  OF HIGHER EDUCATION CAN MAINTAIN THE ACCURACY OF ITS ELECTRONIC DATABASE
    2  SO MESSAGES CAN BE SENT IMMEDIATELY AFTER AN EMERGENCY IS DECLARED.  THE
    3  SERVICE  PROVIDER  SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SECURITY AND RELIABILITY
    4  OF  THE UNIFORM STATEWIDE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION SYSTEM
    5  AND SHALL ENSURE THE UNIFORMITY AND COMPLIANCE THEREOF AS DETERMINED  BY
    6  THE DIVISION;
    7    (C) IN THE CASE OF AN EMERGENCY AT AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION,
    8  SUCH  INSTITUTION  WILL SUBMIT ITS ALERT THROUGH THE EMERGENCY NOTIFICA-
    9  TION SYSTEM PROVIDED BY THE SERVICE PROVIDER, WHICH HAS ENTERED  INTO  A
   10  CONTRACT WITH THE DIVISION; AND
   11    (D) TRANSMIT AN APPROPRIATE EMERGENCY ELECTRONIC MESSAGE TO EACH ELEC-
   12  TRONIC  ADDRESS AND WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE NUMBER FROM THE DATA-
   13  BASE, AND SHALL TRANSMIT AN APPROPRIATE EMERGENCY VOICE MESSAGE TO  EACH
   14  WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE NUMBER.
   15    3.  THE  COMMISSIONER SHALL ESTABLISH SUCH STANDARDS AND REQUIREMENTS,
   16  AS HE OR SHE SHALL  DETERMINE  TO  BE  APPROPRIATE  AND  NECESSARY,  FOR
   17  SERVICE  PROVIDERS  WHICH  WILL  BE  ELIGIBLE  TO BID ON AND PERFORM THE
   18  REQUIREMENTS OF THE CONTRACT  FOR  THE  EMERGENCY  NOTIFICATION  OF  THE
   19  STUDENTS  AND FACULTIES OF INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION. SUCH STAND-
   20  ARDS AND REQUIREMENTS SHALL BE INCLUDED IN THE REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR
   21  SUCH CONTRACT. THE SERVICE PROVIDER AWARDED SUCH CONTRACT SHALL  PROVIDE
   22  FOR  THE INSTALLATION AND OPERATION OF THE EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION SYSTEM
   23  SUBJECT TO THE RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE DIVISION.
   24    4. THE DIVISION SHALL ESTABLISH  AND  ENFORCE  RULES  AND  REGULATIONS
   25  REQUIRING  EVERY  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION TO MAINTAIN AND UPDATE
   26  ITS ELECTRONIC DATABASE IN A TIMELY MANNER.  FURTHERMORE,  THE  DIVISION
   27  SHALL  PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS PROVIDING FOR THE PERIODIC TEST-
   28  ING OF THE EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION SYSTEM ESTABLISHED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   29  SECTION  TO  ENSURE THAT IT REMAINS IN CONSTANT READINESS AND EFFECTIVE-
   30  NESS.
   31    5. NO WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS SERVICE SUPPLIER SHALL IMPOSE ANY FEE OR
   32  CHARGE UPON THE OWNER OF ANY WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE WHICH IN ANY
   33  MANNER RELATES TO THE RECEIPT OF AN EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION  PURSUANT  TO
   34  THIS SECTION.
   35    6.  THE  DIVISION  SHALL CONSULT WITH AND PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO INSTI-
   36  TUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION FOR THE PURPOSE OF INTEGRATING  THE  DISSEM-
   37  INATION OF EMERGENCY NOTIFICATIONS BY MEANS OF THE OTHER PUBLIC INFORMA-
   38  TION SYSTEMS AVAILABLE AT THE CAMPUS OF EACH SUCH INSTITUTION.
   39    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that the uniform
   40  statewide  higher education emergency notification system shall be fully
   41  operational within one hundred eighty days of the effective date of this
   42  act.
